maml:description.maml:para: Helper-function to connect to Microsoft Graph using a configuration from $PROFILE.

Helper-function to connect to Microsoft Graph using a configuration from the loaded profile. See Get-Help about_profiles for more information about the location and syntax of the different profiles avaliable in PowerShell. The Configuration will be used as-is, so for options, use Get-Help Connect-MgGraph

The TenantId to use to connect to Microsoft Graph. The TenantId can be the TenantId, a Custom domain added to the tenant, or the onmicrosoft.com-domain associated with the tenant. This value will override any TenantId from a Configuration
The configuration to use to connect to Microsoft Graph. This will override any global configuration from the loaded profile.

The TenantId to use to connect to Microsoft Graph. The TenantId can be the TenantId, a Custom domain added to the tenant, or the onmicrosoft.com-domain associated with the tenant. This value will override any TenantId from a Configuration
The configuration to use to connect to Microsoft Graph. This will override any global configuration from the loaded profile.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Connect-EvtGraph.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Connect-JGraph -TenantName:'contoso.onmicrosoft.com' Connect to the Contoso-tenant using the configuration found in the loaded profile.

maml:description.maml:para: Helper-function to disconnect to Microsoft Graph.
This exists mostly to make use of Connect-JGraph and Disconnect-JGraph semantically relevant.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Disconnect-JGraph.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more user from Microsoft Graph
Gets one or more user from Microsoft Graph. Attempts to do so with the least amount of 'cost'.
The ObjectId of the user to get from Graph.
The properties of the user to get from Graph.
Retrieves related resources..
Filters results (rows).
Returns results based on search criteria.

Orders results. To sort the results in ascending or descending order, append either asc or desc to the field name, separated by a space; for example, name%20desc. If the sort order is not specified, the default (ascending order) is inferred.
Sets the page size of results.
The properties of the user to get from Graph.
The ObjectId of the user to get from Graph.
The properties of the user to get from Graph.
The properties of the user to get from Graph.
Retrieves related resources..
Filters results (rows).
Returns results based on search criteria.

Orders results. To sort the results in ascending or descending order, append either asc or desc to the field name, separated by a space; for example, name%20desc. If the sort order is not specified, the default (ascending order) is inferred.
Sets the page size of results.

dev:type.maml:name: [String] - Each string will be used as ObjectID
[Object] - If the property ObjectId, UserID or Id exists, it will be attemted to be used as ObjectId.
[PSCustomObject[]] - One or many objects with user-information from Microsoft Graph.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-JGUser Get all users in Microsoft Graph
